intro: Cacalia davidii, commonly known as the David's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of China and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun. Cacalia davidii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
